briefTitle: House Dust Mite Allergy Trial In Children
officialTitle: A One-year Placebo-controlled Phase III Trial Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of the House Dust Mite (HDM) SLIT-tablet in Children (5-11 Years of Age) With HDM Allergic Rhinitis/Rhinoconjunctivitis With or Without Asthma
conditions: Allergic Rhinitis Due to Dermatophagoides Farinae
Allergic Rhinitis Due to Dermatophagoides Pteronyssinus
Allergic Rhinitis Due to House Dust Mite
summary: A research study of how house dust mite tablets work compared to placebo in children aged between 5 and 11 years and who have allergy to house dust mites (MATIC)

primaryOutcome.measure: Average Daily Total Combined Rhinitis Symptom and Medication Score (TCRS) During the Primary Efficacy Assessment Period
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: 8 weeks (primary efficacy assessment period), which started 44-49 weeks after initiation of IMP
